page.title: 11FARMING OWERSBY PIGS
page.content: Manor Farm embraces 104 hectares grow- ing winter wheat,winter barley,winter oil seed rape,potatoes and sugar beet. The soil type is medium loam to heavy clay capable of producing relatively high yields.High nitrogen application (432 units per hectare) on wheat coup- led with good weed and disease control is practised.Storage and drying facil- ities for 800 tonnes are on the farm together with a pig unit of 140 breed- ing sows and accommodation for fatten- ing 2,500 bacon pigs per year.There is also a unit for rearing 50 calves in single pens which alternatively will house 800 6.5k turkeys.After 4yrs. of high cereal prices 1985 harvest prices are 10-15% down.Bacon pigs are now Â£1 per kilo dead weight,fresh oven-ready turkeys Â£2 per kilo.The unit employs 3 full & 1 part-time staff.
